transcript.text:
so I posted a couple weeks ago about doing a Q&A 
for 25,000 Subs which thank you for by the way and

you guys left some really interesting questions 
that I'm going to get to now a lot of you were

wondering how I developed my political views 
and how I ended up on the left I might title

this video why I left the right or something 
like that even though I was never a die-hard

right winger I was just a dumb kid so this 
first batch of questions is pretty much all

the same how did I develop my political views what 
radicalized me so let's get into it I grew up in

a semi-conservative environment my immediate 
family wasn't conservative per se but I went

to a conservative Catholic school because friends 
of my family were sending their kids there so I

guess it made sense for my parents to do the same 
being surrounded by a very conservative faculty

and administration obviously had an impact 
on my worldview I mean we would constantly

have lectures about the depravities and horrors 
of abortion abstinence over safe sex which kind

of backfired because I remember there being some 
uh oopsy pregnancies very very early on I don't

call my science teachers ever teaching us about 
evolution or Darwinism or anything like that but

by 10th grade I understood that I felt differently 
than the majority of my classmates and teachers I

wasn't religious even though we were forced 
to pray every day and go to mass every first

Wednesday of the month looking back at it this 
may have had the inverse effect on me and pushed

me away from religious conservatism I also had gay 
friends at a young age and I had nothing against

them I I quite liked them actually and would get 
pretty pissed off if people mistreated them so I

knew early on I wasn't homophobic I started making 
music at a young age and I decided by 10th or 11th

grade that I wanted to make a career out of it 
my Inspirations were people like Frank Ocean

and Kendrick Lamar this led me to study their 
works and come face to face with perspectives

that were new to me Frank is a bisexual musician 
who touches on this in his music Kendrick touches

heavily on topics like police brutality and 
institutional racism so being a young kid with

Idols like these it was becoming difficult for 
me to relate with the more conservative folks

in my life coming out of high school at age 
17 I was already not super conservative but

I still had some reactionary Tendencies due to my 
environment shortly after enrolling in University

which I only stayed in for a semester I would 
get videos of "Ben Shapiro destroying radical

feminist in the marketplace of ideas" suggested 
to me on YouTube and then similar ones of Jordan

Peterson and Steven Crowder and as time went on 
I would just keep clicking them it was mainly a

bunch of anti-feminist propaganda and videos 
of these grown ass men debating college kids

but at the time I myself was a college kid and I 
couldn't grasp the fact that these debates were

not happening on a levelled playing field although 
I was definitely slipping down the right-wing

pipeline at this point I still never considered 
myself a full-blown conservative because I didn't

know or care much about politics at the time but 
I am ashamed to admit that 17-year-old me thought

they were smart by the time I turned 18 I had some 
music out that was starting to gain some traction

and attention from record labels so I dropped out 
of University moved to Toronto and spent the next

few years bouncing between Toronto Vancouver LA 
and New York I guess being in all of these big

cities and meeting so many different people really 
eradicated any socially conservative ideas that

may have been implanted in me by my upbringing 
and right-wing media my friend group Diversified

the ideas I was presented with Diversified and I 
was meeting people with struggles that I never had

to worry about all of the sudden I was meeting 
and developing friendships with people from all

sorts of socioeconomic backgrounds I was meeting 
people who were suffering with addictions which

was a big eyeopener for me because I perceived 
the conservative position on addiction to be

one of Shame and repudiation and by developing 
friendships with people who were suffering in

that way I was able to see that addiction was 
a mental health issue and that the right had

the wrong ideas about it so at this point I was 
not socially conservative and I was beginning

to develop some class Consciousness I moved back 
to my hometown after the pandemic hit and I met

my girlfriend who I've been with for 5 years now 
her family is from Latin America Chile and through

them I was introduced to Chilean history and the 
brutality of Pinochet and american-backed fascists

not only in Chile but all over the world I went on 
to learn as much as I could about us involvement

in Latin America the Middle East Asia and Africa 
I started to realize that these Americans didn't

really like this socialism stuff from Allende 
and Chile to Mosaddegh in Iran they didn't care

for countries or left-wing leaders who tried to 
take back their nation's resources and use them

to develop their countries so at that point I was 
not only not socially conservative but I had some

class Consciousness and I was Anti-Imperialist 
once I knew these things about myself I picked up

pretty much any book I could find on these topics 
and spent the past four years reading relentlessly

I think it's important to share stories like these 
because there is a possibility that things could

have gone differently if I didn't have gay 
friends at a young age to serve as a reality

check in the face of my conservative environment 
if I never wanted to make hip-hop music if I

never spend so much time bouncing between these 
big cities meeting so many different people and

if I never met my girlfriend's family who knows 
what my beliefs would be so next time you meet a

conservative or someone with views you disagree 
with try to understand that they're probably not

evil people who want the world to suffer maybe 
some are but they're probably just the product

of their material realities if we as leftists 
can understand that and at least try to engage

with them in a way that might change their 
minds given that they're open to good Faith

engagement it not only serves to help them but 
it helps our movement next question why didn't

you plug your music on your Channel fire music by 
the way thanks uh I didn't want to take away from

the activism if you're into alternative hip-hop 
and for some reason recognize any of these songs

that's me I have my Spotify Linked In My Channel 
description But ultimately I made this channel so

I could take my mind off of music and work I was 
doing some bigger projects earlier this year like

commercials and Licensing stuff and it was getting 
to feel feel like a chore not to sound all woe is

me about it I also make pretty political music 
so this channel felt like the next step for me

and it's fun to just nerd out about politics when 
I'm not working on any albums next question would

you consider the USSR and Marxism-Leninism as a 
whole to have been a net positive or net negative

I'm leaning towards net negative with the damage 
it's done to Communism as a whole and how it is

perceived by the West I find myself taking the 
Rosa Luxemburg stance on this I am critical of

leninism I'm not a leninist but when we critique 
leninism we need to understand what they were

working with at the time during the Russian 
Revolution conditions were suboptimal to say

the least they inherited a Russia that was ravaged 
by mismanagement they were constantly subjected to

Wars and conflicts with that said the Bolsheviks 
did transform Russia from a backwards Czarist

regime into one where people had Healthcare and 
education and overall a better quality of life but

I don't think that having a Vanguard party made 
up of professional revolutionaries who operate

on the behalf of the working class constitutes 
a real dictatorship of the proletariat I think

the Vanguard should be made up of the workers 
and I think the Enterprises and state need to

be democratized much more efficiently I don't 
like the Crackdown on dissent I do consider

myself to be more of a Libertarian socialist 
but at the same time I'm okay with the idea

of using the state as a tool in the short term 
to fend off external threats the nature of the

state just needs to be much more democratized 
and the inherently authoritarian elements of

statehood need to be addressed and ameliorated the 
long-term goal for for me obviously would be to

either eradicate the state as I perceive it to be 
an inherently authoritarian force with a monopoly

on violence or to alleviate and democratize its 
more authoritarian elements and Usher in a more

democratic form of governance of course I can 
only express how I feel from my vantage point

if I were someone living under Batista's regime 
in Cuba or in Czarist Russia I would probably be

a Marxist leninist or at least sympathetic to the 
idea so when I criticize ML's it's not because I

hate them I look up to a great many of them look 
behind me I got a- I don't know if you can see it

but it's a Che Guevara poster but because I think 
that future projects need to be more democratic

and directly involve the working class it's not 
a secret that lennin and trosky dismantled the

workers councils and the Soviets once they took 
power that's unacceptable to me to wrap this up

and stop being such a Centrist about this I 
understand why leninism took the shape it did

but I think there are massive flaws within the 
idea I don't like the idea of a one- party State

full of intellectuals who operate on the behalf 
of the worker I don't like the authoritarian

form this is historically taken and I don't think 
that having this elitist group elevated above the

populace serves the spirit of socialism I perceive 
it to be a deviation from my preferred brand of

socialism I think socialism is radical democracy 
this includes full workplace democracy and

transformation of the state and Enterprise this 
was lacking in the USSR to quote Rosa real quick

Freedom only for the members of the government 
only for the members of the party though they are

quite numerous is no Freedom at all freedom 
is always the freedom of the one who thinks

differently not because of Any fanatical concept 
of justice but because all that is instructive

wholesome and purifying in political Freedom 
depends on this essential characteristic and

its Effectiveness vanishes when Freedom becomes 
a special privilege to answer your question about

net negative or positive I don't think I can 
fit my answer within that binary from a Marxist

analysis leninism took the shape it was meant to 
take at the time it was a product of contrasting

material realities and for some it made life 
better I believe it did so at the expense of the

soul of socialism itself but it's still there for 
us to learn from the West's perception of it is

out of our control even looking at past Democratic 
Socialist experiments the West demonized them with

equal fervor we just got to spread the good 
word and let the Perils of capitalism continue

to elevate class Consciousness next question what 
type of socialist are you what is your ideology

I feel like I covered this already uh I'd like 
to say I'm a Libertarian socialist whether or

not my fellow libsocs perceive me to be a pure 
enough libsoc is up to them but I am skeptical

and critical of the inherently authoritarian 
nature of the state if I'm looking down a lot

it's because I'm looking at my computer next 
question what's your favorite music genre band

artist song album Kendrick Lamar Frank Ocean Nina 
Simone Mac Miller Marvin Gaye Lana Del Rey are my

favorites Tyler the Creator as well I like hip-hop 
alternative music folk R&B uh my favorite albums

are Faces by Mac Miller To Pimp a Butterfly by 
Kendrick Lamar Norman [ __ ] Rockwell by Lana

Del Rey and what's going on by Marvin Gaye next 
question this is a really heated suggestion but

I'm curious about how you'd handle going over 
the history and Rise of right-wing Fascism and

how the rise of Nazis can be compared to Trump's 
current rhetoric and plans to implement fascism I

think an analysis on what nationalism could do to 
a country could be an interesting watch if it came

from you so the comparison between past fascist 
regimes and Trump's rhetoric is probably something

that deserves its own full video so I'll leave 
that out but I do want to address the topic of

nationalism really quickly I think it's important 
to understand that nationalism in the developing

world is often rooted in anti-colonialism and 
a different story a guy like Patrice Lumumba

in the Congo who was a nationalist should not be 
graded the same as a guy like Trump nationalism in

the developed World tends to serve as a tool of 
superiority subjugation and exacerbates ingroup

outgroup sentiment this could also happen in the 
developing World Narendra Modi in India is a Hindu

nationalist who uses nationalism to oppress 
Muslims within his country but we need to be

nuanced when discussing nationalism why a country 
or leader is a nationalist and what shape it takes

in each specific instance the nationalism of Latin 
America which is often rooted in anti-imperialism

and anti-colonialism cannot seriously be compared 
to the nationalism of Giorgia Meloni or Donald

Trump that's that's my stance on nationalism next 
question as a progressive what are the things that

you dislike about our side the most well easy 
purity testing and shitty Coalition building

skills as you could probably tell I try my best to 
extend an olive branch to other types of leftists

and look past our differences and towards our 
shared goals I also dislike it when people on the

left completely right off right-wingers I think 
we should try to talk to them and engage in good

faith sometimes I see lefties hold people's pasts 
against them next question what's your opinion

on Bernie I like Bernie I think he's a good 
person and I appreciate that he's many people's

introduction to far-left politics even though he 
isn't really far-left on the world stage I think

Bernie is one of the few people who actually cares 
he's been about it his whole life there's pictures

of him getting arrested at civil rights protests 
when he was a young man is he right 100% of the

time no but in the context of American politics 
he is a very refreshing and important voice and

a very cute old man next question is Canada 
as anti-socialist as the US and how were you

introduced to leftist thinking I already answered 
the second half of this question so let's just go

with is Canada as anti-socialist as the US it's 
starting to be but I think that's a product of

American politics infiltrating us as they usually 
do Canada has free health care and better social

programs than the US so we don't freak out and 
consider those services to be socialist the way

some Americans do because they're not socialist 
we do have a growing MAGA movement up here not too

long ago I was on the highway and a truck passed 
me with Trump 2024 and [ __ ] Trudeau stickers we

also had Tucker Carlson host an event in Alberta 
with the premier Danielle Smith Canada's political

Trends tend to follow America's that's why I 
make content that talks about American politics

because it directly affects my country's political 
landscape also Canada has exported [ __ ] like

Peterson and Crowder and Ted Cruz sorry about 
that so I'm just trying to balance the scales

here next question what is your opinion on not 
safe for work creators using parasocial relations

for their financial benefit not sure that I care 
all that much I don't know if that sounds bad I

don't like parasocial relationships in general but 
I don't think the onus is on the content creator

if someone wants to buy some chick's [ __ ] bath 
water then that's on them of course if someone

is exploiting another person directly and using 
the parasocial relationship in an unethical way I

would be against the usage of that power imbalance 
to coerce someone but this goes for all public

figures not just not safe for work creators next 
question personal Inspirations and heroes Kurt

Vonnegut Rosa Luxemburg Angela Davis Naomi Klein 
Che Guevara Fred Hampton Chomsky Anton Pannekoek

Kendrick Lamar Albert Einstein George Carlin and 
Mac Miller let's throw Mac Miller in there too

I love that guy rip the next few questions are 
pretty similar first one goes what books do you

recommend for learning about Socialism or the 
left and the second one goes can you recommend

any books about the organization of a possible 
socialist society I'm going to answer these two

questions together I don't know if all of these 
books are sold for learning about socialism I

just grabbed some books off my socialism shelf 
Marx is a good place to start if you don't want

to read the three big ass volumes of Kapital 
right away start with wage labor and capital

it's a very quick and short read regardless if 
you're a leninist or an anarchist or whatever

imperialism the highest stage of capitalism by 
Lenin is worth the read reform or Revolution

by Rosa Luxemburg this serves as her rebuttal 
to the ideas of reformism specifically those

of Eduard Bernstein who was a Social Democrat of 
her time the social Democrats back then claimed

to want to do away with capitalism they no longer 
do that today Rosa's critiques do a very good job

at illustrating the hypocrisies revisionism and 
opportunism within Bernstein's ideas and I think

a lot of what she wrote here still holds true 
and can be applicable in the modern socialism

verse social democracy debate socialism utopian 
and scientific by Frederick Engles I referred to

this text earlier but the Russian Revolution 
by Rosa Luxemburg if you want her opinions on

that topic workers councils by Anton Pannekoek 
he wrote this under Nazi occupation in Holland

I feel like Pannekoek best represents my brand of 
socialism so if you want to learn more about what

I believe I would read Pannekoek oh this one's 
really interesting because Oscar Wilde famous

author he wrote The Portrait of Dorian Gray 
he has this little essay called the soul of

man under socialism which I thought was really 
interesting he is also a Libertarian socialist

and if you want to read his thoughts on the topic 
this is a very quick and nice read so I have this

book by Einstein it's called ideas and opinions 
but you don't need to get the book cuz the only

thing I'm going to recommend is an essay that is 
found within the book but you can also find the

essay online it's called why socialism and it's 
literally this long it's like two pages this is

a book that I don't see recommended often but I 
think it's extremely interesting I actually want

to reread it and take notes on it but socialism 
after Hayek envisioning real Utopias by Erik Olin

Wright is a really interesting book too sorry my 
camera died and then I went to go play pickle ball

so this is the next day just to finish up that 
book list anarcho-syndicalism theory and practice

by Rudolph rocker Democratic confederalism by 
Abdullah Ocalan it's just a really tiny pamphlet

it goes over his political ideas which are drawn 
from those of Murray Bookchin and libertarian

socialism this pamphlet and Abdullah Ocalans 
ideas are interesting because we can actually

see them in effect in rojava in northeastern Syria 
so studying his theories and then actually seeing

them in effect in Rojava is is really cool next 
question would you by chance be an anarchist of

some kind I usually go by libertarian socialist 
but sometimes I'll call myself a left Marxist

I agree with anarchists on almost everything a 
lot of people consider libertarian socialism and

anarchism to be synonymous some folks think there 
are slight differences sometimes when someone

identifies as a libsoc there's a tacit implication 
that they could be okay with some forms of

authority as long as it comes about democratically 
so no one party States obviously but

democratically elected leadership for me if a pure 
anarcho-syndicalist Society doesn't come about

but we still find ways to refine the Democratic 
process and ensure our leaders are genuinely

beholden to the best interests of the people and 
discarded if they aren't I think that's an okay

compromise for me so I guess what I'm saying is 
anarchists generally believe what I believe but

they're just way more principled than I am I could 
see myself move more in that direction with time

next question who inspires you in the content 
space I'm always hesitant to co-sign anyone

cuz whenever I do that someone points out a random 
old tweet or thing that person said and assumes I

agree with 100% of that person's decisions when in 
reality I don't actually know all that much about

any of the content creators I like it just click 
their videos when they get suggested with that

being said uh hbomberguy is probably my favorite 
Creator on the platform I think he's really funny

I think he does a really good job keeping you 
entertained while being highly informative I find

Noah Samsen really funny his sense of humor is 
similar to mine and I love the fact that he's been

Relentless in covering the atrocities in Palestine 
Owen Jones Mehdi Hasan Jon Stewart uh I started

getting videos from FD signifier recommended to 
me lately I thought they were really good he gives

friendly cool Uncle Vibes uh I like him same with 
Rebecca Watson sorry I'm just looking at who I've

recently subscribed to Hasan seems like a cool 
guy from what I know about him he seems funny next

question shout out some of your favorite movies 
or digital media as of late I've been watching

kind of like comedy horror movies I just watched 
the substance I guess like a feminist body horror

movie but I thought it was really good I thought 
it was it was really funny I like um the zelda

games on switch I have literally zero time to play 
video games but when I used to have more time I

would really like breath of the wild and I liked 
Super Mario Odyssey I've always liked Mario games

maybe because I'm a short Italian and Mario's a 
short Italian so could have a kind of spiritual

connection with him are you going to make a 
video on the election yes I I made a video on

the election who did you vote for I I'm Canadian 
your thoughts on Marx who's that obviously a guy

like Marx has been very influential in um the 
way I think but like any old philosopher or

person who lived in a completely different era 
I don't think we should take everything that

they wrote as Doctrine I don't think we should 
be dogmatic about it because who knows if that

person was alive today if even they would think 
that the things that they wrote were applicable

to modern society and this is not me saying that I 
don't think Marxism or or the economic theories or

the social theories are not applicable I still do 
I still consider myself a Marxist but there were

things that Marx wrote that I don't agree with 
there were things that Engels wrote that I don't

agree with I don't agree with a lot of what Engels 
wrote on On Authority but this applies to everyone

I don't think anybody is infallible I don't think 
you should be dogmatic no matter how much you like

a person no matter how smart they were would you 
still date me if I was a worm depends on the worm

what is your favorite animal and why isn't it a 
fox I like dogs I'm a big dog guy some might say

I have that dog in me foxes are cool but they 
they kind of got an unnerving sound that they

make that might be where my aversion comes from 
should I make a YouTube channel about politics or

comedy your answer will have an impact obviously 
I'm going to say yes this goes for any creative

endeavour I'm always going to tell you to at least 
try it worst thing that could happen is you find

that you're either not that good at it or you just 
don't like to do it all that much the only way you

would figure that out is if you try it have you 
ever been to Prince Edward Island no I haven't do

you drink and what's your favorite drink sometimes 
I'll have like sake if if the mood is right or

like wine but I I'm not really a drinker 
thoughts on gramsci I think his theories on

cultural hegemony have stood the test of time I'm 
going through the prison notebooks now I got the

the three book collection so I can't fully give 
a detailed opinion on him yet but I do like him a

lot from what I know about him will you ever cover 
UK politics of course if there was a worthwhile

story in UK politics or Canadian politics or 
Australian politics or anywhere in the world

really I would cover it if I felt like I could say 
something worthwhile on the topic all right sorry

if I missed anything this video is already really 
long so I'll just cut it here uh thanks again bye
